intro: Achyrophorus gayi, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, silvery-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Achyrophorus gayi is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland desert environments.
